website_summaries.verdict: Customers wanting a clip-on keyboard tray will admire this oversized, easy-to-assemble model.
pros: Clamp-on design allows for easy assembly and removal of keyboard tray at any time
One of the most spacious keyboard trays available
cons: Customers wish it were higher quality given its expensive price

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: Setup is quick and easy. The clamps are not as wide as I expected - my desk is a very tight fit. It's made of cheap plastic, and the tray wobbles when I type. For the price, I expected something that felt a little more well put together. This feels like a budget product.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: The great review were very mis-leading.
customer_reviews.text: It just doesn't work, constant adjustment, falls off desk. Maybe ghost writers writing good reviews for this.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry K

customer_reviews.title: ~ BEST ITEM IN ITS CLASS EVER ~
customer_reviews.text: Perfect surface for a keyboard plus mouse pad/mouse. Very sturdy and excellent quality. Doesn't shake at all when typing - if it does for you you must have a very crappy desk :) . I use it for my audio producing so that it sits below my midi controller as I don't have a fancy DAW desk and I couldn't be happier. Really. This was something I had been looking for and didn't know it existed !! To the manufacturer of this product: THANK YOU you saved my music production life :)
customer_reviews.author: Buman

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for the quality.
customer_reviews.text: This tray is way overpriced for the quality. While it takes minutes to install, the build quality and tray glide are sub-par. I use my desk a lot, 8+ hours a day and I can't see this tray lasting much longer than about 6 month. If you use your desk less, it will likely last much longer, but again, its a high price to pay for the quality. Coincidentally I have developed a rash and blistering on my right wrist which I use to mouse, I can't say for certain it is the cause, but my wrist clears up on the weekends when I am not working, then gets much worse during the week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly and Looks Good
customer_reviews.text: This simple device took me 5 minutes to install and works perfectly. In the past I've had some bad keyboard trays that just didn't fit or had defective runners that got stuck or ran off the rails. This one has smooth motion yet is firm and solid when you're typing. It also has an elegantly minimalist look to it, so you're not embarrassed to have it in your office. And there's room for a small paper pad if you need to jot something down.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bklyn

customer_reviews.title: Would be a 5 star product if 2 changes are made
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard tray performs its task, but it fails to be an excellent product, unless 2 changes are made: 1) The back side of the tray must have some kind of guard to prevent the mouse from falling down from it. When I slide the tray back, my mouse keeps falling out from the back. In fact, after a day of usage, my mouse actually broke because it fell down so many times. 2) The tray really should be made using a material that is slightly sturdier than the plastic that it's using right now. I don't think it needs to be metal -- may be just a thicker piece of plastic will be enough.
customer_reviews.author: Toys Samurai

customer_reviews.title: works even when sitting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tray because my desk was too tall and my chair too short. Even though the description says its for a standing desk, the tray drops 4 inches from the desk. I needed a 4 inch drop. Works perfectly. The clamp is strong. The tray is sturdy. Even though each side has its own slider, my tray pulls out easily. And the tray is wide enough to easily hold my large, ergo-dynamic keyboard and my large mouse. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: PhillyMomLaughs

customer_reviews.title: Loved it...till now.
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this stand while working remote. It seemed to be working great daily Mon-Fri for about 4 months and it began tilting after being pushed all the way in. And now it tilts so much the keyboard is sliding off and dripping to the ground. I am past the return window and am going to look at some type of grip tape or make shift stopper to get more life out of this before I have to drop more money on a new solution. It doesn’t tip when pulled out for use. Just when it is pushed back in under the desk. For the price paid, this sucks.
customer_reviews.author: VLaimon

customer_reviews.title: serves the purpose, no frills
customer_reviews.text: so, while it's great that you don't have to screw in anything onto the desk, it would be great if the height were adjustable. also, the unit doesn't quite smoothly pull in or out--perhaps the next iteration should include ball bearings and a no-slam soft slide in like kitchen cabinets have? otherwise, very cost effective keyboard tray.
customer_reviews.author: dna_ninja

customer_reviews.title: Great workplace investment
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product. I work from a home office, and have an all-in-one compter. This tray fit my work table perfectly. It is sturdy, steady, easy to assemble. In my job, I use the mouse with one hand and type with the other. This tray gives me options for shifting the positions of the mouse and keyboard, which prevents aches and pains. Great workplace investment.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Fronko

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for flimsy, uneven plastic
customer_reviews.text: A very interesting idea, but way too expensive given the following: 1) almost entirely plastic, except for the clamps, which are super-sturdy; 2) because the tray is plastic injection molded, the typing surface (i.e., the entire point of the item) is uneven and flimsy); 3) the clamps, being metal, aren’t a good fit for the tracks, which are plastic. Basically, it feels like the tracks are going to break every time I open and closed the tray. Maybe, just maybe, had the purchase price been reasonable ($10-15) this would’ve been an acceptable purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JBSmoove2

customer_reviews.title: Stand Steady Clamp on Keyboard Tray is easy to assemble and is perfect for my antique desk
customer_reviews.text: I have experienced shoulder problems due to my computer desktop, an antique desk, being too high in relation to my chair. I purchased the Stand Steady Clamp On Keyboard Tray, and it was just what I needed to lower my keyboard and place me in a correct ergonomic seated position at my computer. I've used this for a couple of weeks with an orthopedic pillow and thus far, it meets my expectations. The tray is simple to assemble. I was concerned about attaching the tray to the antique desk, but I put a couple of pieces of thin cardboard under the clamps. When the tray is pushed in, it's barely noticeable and seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Super ergonomic, but wobbly
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard tray has been really good at improving my posture at my desk. You want to have your forearms parallel with the ground, and if you have a high desk, you can either raise your chair or lower your desk. If you raise your chair, you need a footrest so your feet can rest well or else you'll get really bad tightness in your glutes and hams. It can be hard to lower your desk, so this makes up for that by lowering the position of the keyboard and mouse. It works well, but the tray itself is quite wobbly, possibly due to the casters. Overall, not bad, but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Measure your desk top thickness
customer_reviews.text: Love this product and it was very easy to install. It will work perfect for my needs too! As others have mentioned, 2” for clamps to fit is INCORRECT. Mine is 1 3/4 and only fit with removing the washers which is just fine. (It would not be for a glass top though) 1.5” or less would would be ideal. All in all the plastic tray is heavy enough to work fine and the tray size is generous for mousepad etc.... Loved not having to drill into the desk! It’s a keeper !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stand Steady Easy Clamp On Keyboard Tray  works well with electrical adjusting desk
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tray. It is great for the price. I can take it off easily to use elsewhere or to let others see if it is good on their desks. I even bought the large one for my daughter. Other more complicated trays got in the way of the electrical work on her height adjusting desk. I got her the extra large size. The small one does not fit a keyboard that has the calculator on the right side. I had space restrictions so had to get the small size for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Tormlee

customer_reviews.title: Well-built and very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, but they need better quality control on packaging. I ordered 2 units, each of which requires 4 small screws to assemble. Easy to assemble with screwdriver they include, but one unit had 5 screws and the other unit had none. I went to Ace to pick up matching screws for about 2 bucks, so no big deal, just inconvenient. Would not let me stop from ordering another if needed, and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and it attached very fast. Have been using it for a couple of weeks now and I am going to order another one at the end of the month for the other desk in my office. That is how well I liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Garbage
customer_reviews.text: After 4 hours of use, the tray began to slant forward at a 5 degree angle. The sliding tracks stopped working properly, and began to get stuck. Build quality almost doesn't even make any sense, clamps are made out of quality, solid steel, but the screw component is incredibly cheap and weak. The tray itself is cheap, weak plastic. Lean on it too hard and it'll absolutely snap in half. This product is made up of about $1 dollar of raw materials, and lacks any coherent engineering or design.
customer_reviews.author: K. Grotte

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I love the clamp idea. It slides pretty good but you have to apply a little pressure for the tray to slide smoothly. I am thinking of putting WD-40 on the rollers to see if this helps. I love the length so I can put my mouse on the side. It is a great improvement to the other keyboard trays that you have to attach under the desk. I would buy it again. It is very simple to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Debra K. Mann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect length.  Easy to install and use.
customer_reviews.text: Overall is is a good product. It does get a little wobbly when sliding in and out. The rolled front eged is nice and one of the reasons I chose this product. The length is perfect to have the mouse is easy reach next to the keyboard rather then hanging out on a side tray. I wish it had a tilt feature rather than always being flat. I was not able to find a clamp on tray that did.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Really works well!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our needs. Unfortunately, our deak (table) prevents it from being placed completely under it, but maybe we can trim some of the wood to allow it to slide back about an inch. Other than sticking out a little (which is because of our desk) it is exaxctly what we were looking for. Hopefully, the designer will consider other colors -- white!
customer_reviews.author: Trish S

customer_reviews.title: Setup takes only minutes and it's incredibly useful!
customer_reviews.text: This peice of equipment saved my neck! Literally! I tend to hunch and reach when my keyboard and mouse sit on my desk with my computer monitors. Tension headaches, nausea, and neck/shoulder strain are so common for me, even in the office. Now that I'm working from home for an indeterminate amount of time (I'm a huge introvert, so you better believe I'm hoping for indefinite rather than indeterminate), I decided to fix my setup to relieve stress and body pains, and increase my productivity as much as possible. This product is such a great addition to my desk and so simple to install!
customer_reviews.author: NekoIssa

customer_reviews.title: Works great for sit-down desk as well
customer_reviews.text: I'd been looking for a replacement for my regular (sit-down) under desk keyboard/mouse tray for quite a long time. My previous one was plastic, which broke when my granddaughter claimed up on it. And it was a real hassle to install, laing on my back reaching up to attach the runners with 8 screws to the underside. Other trays were too small or impossible to span a board reinforcement on the underside of the desk deck.. This one is perfect. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, simple, and fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly as promised. Super easy to setup and install. Slides smoothly. Feels sturdy. Great width. One thing to be aware of. It hangs a little low so make sure you have clearance. I just barely fit under it.
customer_reviews.author: Fred James

customer_reviews.title: and it works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I assembled it according to the clear directions on the packaging in about three minutes. I am using it on a glass desk, and it works like a charm. Very sturdy (make sure you tighten the clamps). I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Abercrombie

customer_reviews.title: Too Expensive
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for the last week and have been fairly unimpressed. For the price I paid I expected something much sturdier and smoother. This unit does not slide all that smoothly and the tray is a pretty flimsy plastic. The installation was wonderful and I love the idea behind the design but for what this product is currently the price was too high.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Wommack

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This product is just what I needed to add a keyboard tray to my new sit-stand desk. I ordered the wider one, so that there would be plenty of room to position the mouse next to the keyboard, and it worked out perfectly. Assembly is a no brainer...screw on the 2 side brackets (screwdriver supplied too) and you are good to go. There are rubber pads attached to the brackets, so there is no fear of damaging the desktop surface. Glad I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: MB in FL

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it’s a good keyboard tray. It’s large and easy to assemble on my desk. I like that the tray can be pushed back trout of the way when done. The only thing that could make it better is the ball bearings are not the best and it doesn’t slide as smooth as it seems like it should. It’s ok for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I got it for work as I am not able to get a keyboard tray that mounts to the desk. I was using clamp on mouse pads as a keyboard tray, but this is so much better. Much bigger and it slides in and out. It took about 3 min to put together--even comes with a screwdriver. I highly recommend this for anyone that needs a keyboard tray!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jean O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Ordered for Work From Home Setup
customer_reviews.text: My old desk set up was fine for a couple of days of work from home. But not for daily work from home. I ordered this because I needed a bigger tray than the one that came with my desk. The instructions were covered by the address/packing label. But this was still really easy to put together. Took about 5-1- minutes. The initial spot I wanted to put it by didn't work for me. This was easy to move and no damage to the desk. Also, it arrived earlier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Product breaks quickly!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is not made well at all the screws pop out easily!! Product broke quickly. I am disappointmented with this purchase. I will nor reorder this again!!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Martin

customer_reviews.title: The best part is that I could install it myself in ...
customer_reviews.text: The best part is that I could install it myself in minutes. It stays in place and rolls in an out very smoothly. Be sure to measure the length needed to fit desk, it is very long, mine just fit the space between the sides of the desk. One thing I don't like is how low it is, I needed to lower my chair and now I feel to low for the rest of my desk. But I do like the space it gives me now on my desk with the keyboard off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 10 star for Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I have never bought any device that was so easy to install! I think it took 10 minutes and easily half of that was just getting it out of the box and plastic bags. Very simple, anyone can do it. It is also very ergonomic, I like it is a little lower than most trays to provide the perfect fit. It glides easily. Well worth spending a little extra, the aggravation of drilling holes is gone! Highly, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Steve and/or MH Sprecher

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomically Friendly
customer_reviews.text: Our desk is taller than average, (30 inches tall) making it ergonomically difficult for someone 5'11 and under to use, even in a tall office chair. This keyboard was exactly as seller described. It was very easy to assemble/mount underneath the desk (wood). The keyboard tray has made it so much easier to use the keyboard. . .less back strain. With a 30-inch high desk, the keyboard installed is 24.5 inches, making it much easier to use. I highly recommend this product. We received the product in just two days with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for an 18lbs cat but not a 2015 MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a fantastic product. I bought this for my home office hoping to use it as a tray for my MacBook Pro. Tray itself a great. Assembly and installation were quick and easy. My only complaint (and this is totally on me) is that the tray itself is a little too small in depth when my MacBook is open and in use. Otherwise, the tray appears sturdy but is actually quite light. So far it’s survived my 18lbs cat jumping and sitting on it. I do get a little nervous when I put weight on the tray while typing, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Tavdi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This product works as stated. Easy to install (my main concern) ot does leave the vibes sticking up on either side. The tray slides easily, but it is so thin and flimsy I worry I will crack it. All in all it was what I had to have to work from home.
customer_reviews.author: arewetheryet

customer_reviews.title: Useful keyboard tray.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a pretty basic keyboard tray. It’s clearly not as sturdy as the king that screws I’m underneath your desk where you can adjust height and angle but it’s enough to get me through my 2 days of working from home. I like that it’s long enough to fit both my keyboard & mousepad.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my use case
customer_reviews.text: I needed a keyboard tray for the keyboard and mouse on my music workstation. The table is quite slender because the room is small. This lets me pull out my computer keyboard when I need it, and put it away when I don't. Also, I'm still trying to figure out how I'm going to arrange my computer and other equipment in the studio. So the clamps will let me easily change my mind later without drilling holes into the table.
customer_reviews.author: Paco Hope

customer_reviews.title: Product is excellent
customer_reviews.text: It was what I needed at my office desk. My desk is too high for me and no matter what I did to raise mu chair, it jist wasn't working for me. To top it all off I had severe dizziness every day from my arms being in an upward slant. Bad. But this has solved my issue and no more dizziness! My arms and hands are finally in the proper position. Thank you for helping me feel better!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Anderson

customer_reviews.title: No screw installation
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard tray is perfect. The size is big enough for a full size keyboard and external mouse with room to spare. Two strong hand screws secure it to your desk. I had mine ready to use two minutes out of the box. Best keyboard tray I've ever had -- and I've used several.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard Tray!
customer_reviews.text: Great tray...it did only take 5 minutes to put the clamps on and attach to the surface I'm using for the tray. Needed 4 screws...manufacturer provided 5 screws AND a real screwdriver for the screws. Tray is sturdy and doesn't move at all when typing. My keyboard with a gel wrist rest and a fat mouse pad with a gel wrist rest fit on it with some inches to spare. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: jillyd

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard, exactly what I was looking for. Sturdy easy to assemble, only 4 screws to clamp on the holders, then slid on my desk, tightened the clamps and ready to go. I might add my desk was glass and was about 1/2" dimension, but the clamps tightened securely to desk.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Craig

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing for about four months. The clamp system is nice as you don't need to worry about putting holes in your desk, however the track and slide system are really cheap. They're made from plastic and tend to be fussy if you don't slide it in just so. I've had the constant issue of the screws coming out of the slider on the bottom of the tray. It fell apart last night so I will be purchasing a different model from another company. Something that's a little sturdier. I would recommend this if you lightly use your computer, but not if you're frequently online for work or school.
customer_reviews.author: SteveV

customer_reviews.title: East to install perfect for my keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: I really needed a lowered keyboard tray. This one is perfect, it is long enough for my keyboard and mousepad and mouse. Very easy to install. It can move a little if I pound a little too hard on the keyboard. But all in all so glad I feel this!
customer_reviews.author: Shutterbug

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is the largest keyboard stand I could find. It is much smaller than my previous one. It does work well, however. There isn't as much room for the mouse pad as I need, so I put a small book under the mouse pad to extend the area. Otherwise I'm happy with my purchase, and hope that it won't break easily as it is only plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Susie, Olympia WA

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this because a shoulder surgery made lifting arms to table height to type uncomfortable. Easy to assemble and install. Turned my table and working area into a very comfortable combo.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Well Built and well designed
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent, full sized keyboard/mouse tray. Better than many on the market. Generous in size. My only complaint is the large size of the desktop portion of the support brackets. It's a minor drawback, but they do get in the way when lounging on the desktop.
customer_reviews.author: la griffith

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. It was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I just assembled to my desk this week. So far so good. It was easy to assemble, the company even put a screwdriver into the box so I didn't have to go hunt one down at the job. It is fairly secure, easy to put together, and helps keep my wrist level to avoid wrist pain. I would recommend this product if the boss won't let you screw something into the desk, which was my case. My only criticism is I wish I could adjust the angle. Otherwise, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Marti

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard tray
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the tray that came with the desk (it fell of after only a few weeks). This tray is very easy to install. You screw the clamps onto the tray, then clamp the tray to the desk. Also, the tray is big enough for a gaming keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Mickeyrae

customer_reviews.title: Not Level
customer_reviews.text: The clamp on keyboard slide clamps in the front to your desk. This leaves the back of the slide unsupported. So, my mouse and keyboard continually slide off the backside when I slide it under my desk, because it’s only supported in the front the whole thing is not level.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Dunkman

customer_reviews.title: It proves my productivity
customer_reviews.text: I tried another similar product before this one, it really works and more sturdy than the last one. I enjoyed it especially with my standing desk, so i can adjust the height to the best. My arms and waist feel much comfortable after using it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: It's uh, not good.
customer_reviews.text: While this keyboard tray is easy to install, that's kinda the only good thing I can say about it. This tray is *incredibly* flimsy. After just three months it had basically fallen apart (the screws would periodically just drop right out), and even after I'd replaced them, the tray itself was so wobbly that it made typing uncomfortable. IMO, spend a little bit more money and buy one that isn't mostly plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hornyak

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Tray
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely overpriced for what you get. The clamps are sturdy, but the tray itself is pretty cheap. The mechanism when pulling and pushing gets stuck. The tray also tilts slightly downward... it's not completely flat.
customer_reviews.author: SxLxUxGxZ

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not very sturdy and lacks ability to adjust height
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for my recording studio computer, it works, but not very sturdy and lacks the ability to adjust distance between desk and keyboard rack. The price is a bit high, so value not the best. Very easy to install though.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I needed a keyboard tray because my wrist was hurting and my fingers were becoming fatigued while typing on the keyboard which was placed on the table. This keyboard tray is perfect for my needs. It was easy to install, my keyboard and mouse both fit on the tray. My wrist stopped hurting and my fingers are nit fatigued.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: It would be better to spend more for a better tray. This thing is very flimsy. I consciously try to treat it gently. But I know I'm going to eventually break it. It also gets stuck easily, as one side slides out more than the other. I have to be careful to slide both sides evenly and slowly. Not happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't use kept moving
customer_reviews.text: You have to have a perfectly square table for this to work. Sides of my desk were rounded a bit and it kept slipping and slipping off. Could not steady it as you could something that is screwed into the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY! A keyboard tray that doesn't take hours to install
customer_reviews.text: So easy to attach--just slide onto your desktop and adjust clamps. Instant presto--done! No more trying to decipher bad directions for assembly. No more crawling under your desk and turning yourself into a pretzel to screw in. Why didn't somebody think of this years ago?!
customer_reviews.author: Eliza G

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my staff.
customer_reviews.text: My staff has only used it for 2 days. So far so good. Pull out tray is a bit wobbly but overall it is a good product. The tray is nice and wide so it fits both the keyboard and mousepad comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: jlee

customer_reviews.title: Installed on Curved L-Shaped desk and worked!
customer_reviews.text: This works great. We installed it in the corner area of an L-Shaped desk - where it is curved and it still fit great! It doesn't go all the way flush with the edge when closed, because the desk above is curved, but looks great anyway and is working well!
customer_reviews.author: BrownySquare

customer_reviews.title: CLAMPS can damage nicer wood
customer_reviews.text: Be careful there is no cushion on the clams -the are not very wide- would have been great if they were able to expand more and if they came with a way to cushion the space between where the clamp hits the wood or where you are attaching it so it would not damage the wood with the pressure.
customer_reviews.author: DEF

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: $70 for cheap plastic piece of junk. Very wobbly. Definitely not worth $70. I wish I could return mine, but it’s been too long since my purchase date. It might be worth $20.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a keyboard tray for sometime now that would with my current desk. This tray is wonderful. I had originally purchased the small tray but then returned for the large tray. The large tray holds my keyboard and mouse perfectly and is very sturdy and easy to install. Would highly recommend the large tray!!!
customer_reviews.author: VegGirl

customer_reviews.title: Clamp on keyboard desk is good
customer_reviews.text: We love the keyboard desk that clamps onto our work area. We recommend it with big smiles. The only thing we can say is that there was no instructions inside our packaging. The item was easy to install but we did have some questions and having a set of instructions would always help. Put them in the next ones. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Muriel G. Yantiss

customer_reviews.title: Way more sturdy than I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: I knew that the base was plastic and it clamps onto your desk, so I was not expecting much. I figured it's worth the price. This is way more sturdy than I thought and gives me lots of desk space for writing things out! Even if it breaks in a year, I would more than likely buy again, but I have a lot of confidence this will last me a while.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation feels a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Gave me the proper height I needed for my wrist. Seems a little flimsy, so I have concerns r/t long term durability. Overall still an excellent product. Had it set up in literally 5 minutes. Put mine on a utility table, but would work on nearly any surface
customer_reviews.author: Çlmc

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to attach to desk. Only issue I have and it's not this products problem.. My desk is a sit stand and the memory setting box for the desk makes me unable to put it directly in front of me.. So I am sitting off to the side a bit.. Just an FYI to others.. But works great..
customer_reviews.author: Amous

customer_reviews.title: Stand Steady Easy Clamp on Keyboard Tray is a Winner, all that it needs to be.
customer_reviews.text: I like that that it attached to my shelf easily and securely. I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Redd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard Tray!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with my new keyboard tray. It was super easy to install and it came with all the tools needed to get it installed so I didn’t have to worry about having any tools to set it up. I added it to my table and can easily move to whatever place I want. It’s super steady and it fits my huge keyboard and my mouse. It slides quietly and smoothly. I just love it! Great purchase! I definitely recommend it! 5 starts!!
customer_reviews.author: Naila Carneiro

customer_reviews.title: Really big and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Fits mouse and keyboard with plenty of room; makes using standard keyboard and mouse especially comfortable because I can keep my elbows on the arms of my desk chair. Looks very utilitarian (not fashionable/pretty), but it’s exactly what I was looking for. It slightly annoys me that the sort of ugly white branding is right out in the open on the right clamp, but not enough to dock by a full star.
customer_reviews.author: Seattlan

customer_reviews.title: Second one I've bought
customer_reviews.text: East to position and wide enough for a keyboard, mousepad and mouse. Mine gets heavy use with me resting on it constantly and it'salways been sturdy. It's a really well-designed product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Nice and spacious
customer_reviews.text: This was a great economical keyboard tray and I love how big it is. The slide is very smooth and lightweight. I have a curved, boomerang-shaped desk and that was almost a problem, but I was able to make it work. It would be nice if the clamps were able to swivel to grip different angles.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Wright

customer_reviews.title: He is very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: This had offered the correct height for my son's computer. He is very happy with it. It seems very stable and well made. We like this very much, a perfect solution to the computer desk we have.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne V

customer_reviews.title: Maximum thickness 1.5 inches
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I had to return this item. The desk that I tried to attach it to is 1.75 inches thick. Although the information on Amazon said that the clamps are 2 inches wide the box that it came in clearly says maximum thickness, 1.5 inches. So, I was unable to use the product. It seemed to be well made and I don't want to punish the seller for Amazon's error but I cannot give a high rating to something I was unable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Tusler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install and Useful!
customer_reviews.text: I needed more desk space and I got tired of getting eraser shavings into my keyboard. This had extra room and it worked very well with a Logitech wireless keyboard and mouse. I am extra productive as a result and the price was right!
customer_reviews.author: Anh V. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This product was not worth the money spent, but decided to keep it to use as a holding tray. Worth less than $20, is not adjustable or sturdy. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chocolate lover

customer_reviews.title: Good product, WAY over priced.
customer_reviews.text: This does what it should do and is as described, but feels cheap and should cost maybe $20 at most. NOT 80. Kind kf ridiculous. Can’t go below 4 stars because it is what it is but holy cow is this expensive for a plastic tray...
customer_reviews.author: Max fattoruso

customer_reviews.title: Takes up too much space under the desk.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it, too bulky and used too much space under the desk, no room for legs without lowering the chair as low as it would go.
customer_reviews.author: Tawnya Lee-Hurst

customer_reviews.title: All in one packaging, lived up to it's title!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so very pleased with this product. I was very impressed by the packaging and thought put into the product. They even put a small screwdriver in so that you didn't have to search for one!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to my desk
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for two weeks. It is good. I like that I can slide it out for use and slide back in when I am done. This product was worth the coins spent. I can use at work and/or at home.
customer_reviews.author: bukfan26

customer_reviews.title: Very strudy, slides nice, quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Keyboard slides as best as expected. I ordered the "may be scratched" version and it was virtually flawless. One feature that would be nice is height adjustment. I put a couple blocks of wook under my top clip to adjust it to my preferred height.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Basel

customer_reviews.title: Tray hangs too low
customer_reviews.text: Decent tray. For the price I paid, I thought it would be sturdier.Also I wish there was some kind of height adjuster on the clamps. This keyboard tray hangs way too low. Can't fit my legs under my desk now, because the tray hang so low.
customer_reviews.author: dayton mickens

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts and poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts. Poorly packaged and looks like small parts fell off through box during shipping. imo not sturdy enough for nearly $90 product.
customer_reviews.author: Katsu K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy install,nice option to your desk.
customer_reviews.text: Well built and convenient option to add to your table top/ desk. Well worth the money to have more top desk space. You will have to keep you chair a few inches lower though.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly (I got the 30" one). Very simple to install and easy to move if you don't like where you put it. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone. Delivered by seller on time and as described.
customer_reviews.author: es8140

customer_reviews.title: Front goes down too far
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install but the front lip goes down so low that it hit my legs. This made the tray unusable for me. If you need to have your chair higher, I would look at some of the other options out there.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Great way to get a keyboard stand and improve posture!
customer_reviews.text: We have sit/stand desks in the office and we were able to get these installed within 15 minutes. Very sturdy - lots of space! Highly recommended. Definitely a 1 person installation.
customer_reviews.author: Buba

customer_reviews.title: Good slider
customer_reviews.text: Product is good. The slide system is still a little sloppy for my taste as one side an pull out before the other creating some binding. Other than that it’s nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Spalding

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: The length is a perfect size for a large keyboard with a mouse beside it. Ot fits snug on the desk without any damage. It doesn't slide as well as I liked, but a little wd40 rubbed on with a rag and it works nearly perfect. It does stick out slightly (less than an inch) when completely closed.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: Slides due to pressure while using mouse and keyboard. The sticky pads slide nearly off so I have to remove and reposition.
customer_reviews.author: Lightning

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I would have had to trash my desk & order a new one if not for this product. It is just wonderful & I suggest it to anyone that has a keyboard draw that is falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: SueS

customer_reviews.title: Easy and functional.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble and attach to the desk. It's sturdy enough for me to rest my arms on. The only thing that I'd like it to have is an easy way to adjust the height.
customer_reviews.author: Clam Liquor

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard tray is great in many ways -- easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard tray is great in many ways -- easy to install, wide, flat, sturdy... There are two things that would improve this tray a lot for my use. The first is a vertical height adjuster. I don't see a way to adjust the height and it's too low for me. So, I've over-corrected from a desk that's too tall to a keyboard tray that's too low. The other improvement would be smoother glides for pulling the tray out. Not critical, but would be nice to have at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Karyn S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have a wood desk that is long and not made for computers. So I needed something for my keyboard, but didn't want to drill any holes. This is perfect. Easy to attach and just the right height. Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: MizUnderstood

customer_reviews.title: Computer keyboard extention
customer_reviews.text: Love it......I had limited space to work and this was not only easy to apply, but has made my work day much better.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn V. Scalzitti

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea but poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to assemble, and tray slides in and out easily, unfortunately the tray is made of a very flimsy plastic. With the price would have expected something more substantial, even an oem freebie keyboard feels more solid. Would say at most this product should be 20 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and attach to the computer so quick ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes working on the computer so much easier. I work at a hospital and our manager even took pictures of it. I bought a wrist pad also. Easy to use and attach to the computer so quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Bison56

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad. Super easy install.
customer_reviews.text: Mind you, I've only had this installed for a few days, but I've no wobble issues and have had major flexing issues as I type. Very easy to install. Only quibble so far is that you can't adjust the height (unless you some funky at home spacers) so it better be the height you want to type at or...?
customer_reviews.author: SnowLeopard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to get your keyboard and mouse off of your desk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an electric sit/stand desk to get my keyboard off the top of the desk. It installed super easy and does exactly what I needed. My keyboard and mouse have plenty of room. I love that it slides under the desk when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Barrow

customer_reviews.title: Good for larger size keyboard with mouse
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the purpose - which was to fit a regular size keyboard and a mouse. It must be treated with respect, since it is 33" wide. So don't try to exert a lot of pressure, like trying in to it on it or keep a kid on lap etc.
customer_reviews.author: SBal

product_meta.title: Stand Steady Easy Clamp On Keyboard Tray - Extra Large Size - No Need to Screw Into Desk! Slides Under Desk - Easy 5 Min Assembly - Great for Home or Office!
feature_bullets: EASY ASSEMBLY: Set up your new keyboard tray in 5 minutes! No need to put holes in your existing desk - Your new keyboard tray will clamp on your desk in seconds. The entire unit is 33 inches long with clamps included while the tray itself is 27.5 inches long.
SMOOTH GLIDING TRAY: Slide your new keyboard tray under your desk and out of the way when not in use. When you need the extra space simply pull out the keyboard tray and start using it instantly!

FITS MOST DESKS: The Stand Steady Keyboard Tray will fit most desks that are wider than 33 inches and have a thickness of 1.5 inches or less. **Tray will NOT work with beveled-edge desks.** Tray will hang 6 inches below the surface of your desk!
EXTRA LARGE SURFACE: This is one of the largest and most spacious desk trays on the market! With a 27.5” x 12” surface you can fit your keyboard, mouse, and all your extra knick-knacks.

ERGONOMIC DESIGN/ NO DAMAGE TO EXISTING DESK: Your keyboard tray has a very modern sleek design. It’s easy clamp on feature (with padding!) means no damage to your existing under desk. With your comfort in mind, it has an ergonomic beveled edge to decrease the pressure on your wrist.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars541 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
